com.alvarpq.GOTF.coreGame.units

Interface MoveType

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MoveType.Immovable, MoveType.NonAdjacent, MoveType.Normal

    public interface MoveType
    This interface defines the different move types a unit can have.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MoveType.Immovable
      A move type which makes a unit unable to move.
      static class  MoveType.NonAdjacent
      A move type which makes a unit only being able to move to non-adjacent tiles.
      static class  MoveType.Normal
      The normal move type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canMove(Unit unit, int row, int column, Side mySide, Side opponentsSide, Unit[][] mySideUnits)
      The function used to check if a unit can move.
      boolean move(Unit unit, int row, int column, Side mySide, Side opponentsSide, Unit[][] mySideUnits)
      The function used to move a unit.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        boolean move(Unit unit,
             int row,
             int column,
             Side mySide,
             Side opponentsSide,
             Unit[][] mySideUnits)
        The function used to move a unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to move
        row - the row to move the unit to
        column - the column to move the unit to
        mySide - the unit's side
        opponentsSide - the side of the unit's opponent
        mySideUnits - all the units on the unit's side
        Returns:
        whether the unit has moved or not

      • canMove

        boolean canMove(Unit unit,
                int row,
                int column,
                Side mySide,
                Side opponentsSide,
                Unit[][] mySideUnits)
        The function used to check if a unit can move.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to move
        row - the row to move the unit to
        column - the column to move the unit to
        mySide - the unit's side
        opponentsSide - the side of the unit's opponent
        mySideUnits - all the units on the unit's side
        Returns:
        whether the unit can move or not
